content.raw:
The problem was that I had an old version of math3 installed, therefore I thought it should be there. The cmake script doesn't install the math3 headers, which I was wrongly assuming:

`set (INCLUDE_INSTALL_DIR_POSTFIX "ignition/${IGN_PROJECT_NAME}${PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION}")`

Using tag ignition-math\_3.2.0 it now compiles.

I removed the requirement for math4 again. Sorry for the confusion.
content.html:
The problem was that I had an old version of math3 installed, therefore I thought it should be there. The cmake script doesn't install the math3 headers, which I was wrongly assuming:

set (INCLUDE_INSTALL_DIR_POSTFIX "ignition/${IGN_PROJECT_NAME}${PROJECT_MAJOR_VERSION}")

Using tag ignition-math_3.2.0 it now compiles.

I removed the requirement for math4 again. Sorry for the confusion.

content.raw:
I've been (slowly) increasing the test coverage for sdformat, so when we add new functions, it would be best not to go backwards on that.  You can see the current test coverage by doing something like this:

```
cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Coverage
make
make test
make coverage
```

And then looking at the resulting build/coverage/index.html with your favorite web browser.

Thanks!
content.html:
I've been (slowly) increasing the test coverage for sdformat, so when we add new functions, it would be best not to go backwards on that. You can see the current test coverage by doing something like this:

cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Coverage
make
make test
make coverage

And then looking at the resulting build/coverage/index.html with your favorite web browser.

Thanks!

content.raw: When you say "using the newest default branch of ignition", do you mean `ign-math3` or `default`? `default` has the project major version to 4, so it wouldn't install any headers to `include/ignition/math3`. Does the build succeed using the branch `ign-math3`?
content.html: When you say "using the newest default branch of ignition", do you mean ign-math3 or default? default has the project major version to 4, so it wouldn't install any headers to include/ignition/math3. Does the build succeed using the branch ign-math3?

content.raw:
Strange, build succeeds in a docker container on my machine with ignition-math3.

```
#!bash
$ apt show libignition-math3-dev
Package: libignition-math3-dev
Version: 3.2.0-1~xenial
```

And the header seems to be there.
```
#!bash
$ ls -lh /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math/Color.hh 
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 11K May 15 17:09 /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math/Color.hh
$ grep /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math.hh -e "Color"
 #include <ignition/math/Color.hh>
```
content.html:
Strange, build succeeds in a docker container on my machine with ignition-math3.

$ apt show libignition-math3-dev
Package: libignition-math3-dev
Version: 3.2.0-1~xenial

And the header seems to be there.

$ ls -lh /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math/Color.hh 
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 11K May 15 17:09 /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math/Color.hh
$ grep /usr/include/ignition/math3/ignition/math.hh -e "Color"
 #include <ignition/math/Color.hh>

content.raw:
mm weird [Color.hh header file](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e86e5bb392e44404561046c0a7597596f8385401/include/ignition/math/Color.hh?at=ignition-math3_3.2.0) should be there in ign-math3. I just tested this patch without bumping the ign-math version and it built fine for me.

Maybe `VERBOSE=1  make` will show where it's looking for the ign-math include files?
content.html:
mm weird Color.hh header file should be there in ign-math3. I just tested this patch without bumping the ign-math version and it built fine for me.

Maybe VERBOSE=1 make will show where it's looking for the ign-math include files?

This is strange, you must have gotten the same error yourself, I'm a bit confused now :wink: I need version 4 to compile. See also my inline comment below: a `grep -r Color <my-install-path>/include/ignition/math3` doesn't get me anything... I'm using the newest default branch of ignition.

‌

In file included from /home/jenny/oslibs/sdformat/include/sdf/SDFImpl.hh:24:0,

‌                 from /home/jenny/oslibs/sdformat/src/Converter.cc:25:

/home/jenny/oslibs/sdformat/include/sdf/Param.hh:218:36: error: ‘Color’ is not a member of ‘ignition::math’

content.raw:
I did't get the issue when building Gazebo, but when building sdformat itself... I then built Gazebo (default branch from about 4 weeks ago) for my project and everything is still in order.

Because Param.hh includes `ignition/math.hh` this should have gotten the ignition::math::Color. As soon as I bumped the version, it worked.

Also, a `grep -r Color <my-install-path>/include/ignition/math3` doesn't find anything... I'm using the newest default branch of ignition.
content.html:
I did't get the issue when building Gazebo, but when building sdformat itself... I then built Gazebo (default branch from about 4 weeks ago) for my project and everything is still in order.

Because Param.hh includes ignition/math.hh this should have gotten the ignition::math::Color. As soon as I bumped the version, it worked.

Also, a grep -r Color <my-install-path>/include/ignition/math3 doesn't find anything... I'm using the newest default branch of ignition.
